intro: Myosurus breviscapus, commonly known as the short-capped myosurus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
